channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: From Making $40K/Year as a Teacher to Reaching FI in 4 Years by Doing THIS
item.description: You can take your time to reach financial independence, but why wait? With a combination of hard work, savvy investing, and additional income streams, today’s guest reached FI by the […]

item.title: GrubMarket has acquired Good Eggs
item.description: Sources with knowledge of the deal said it was an all-stock transaction that valued Good Eggs slightly above its previous valuation of $22 million. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: They Exposed Police Misconduct. Now They’re Paying a Steep Price.
item.description: Whistleblower laws have advanced in public and private sectors, but protections for police who report illegal or unethical behavior lag far behind.

item.title: San Francisco Leaders Approve Measure to Ban Price-Setting Software To Combat High Rent Prices
item.description: The city may become the first in the country to ban tech tools allegedly associated with rent price fixing.

item.title: UK’s Riverlane scores $75M to correct quantum errors
item.description: Quantum computing may still largely be in the theoretical domain, but the money that it’s attracting is very real. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Facing Rollbacks, Criminal Justice Reformers Argue Policies Make People Safer
item.description: Advocates are refining their rebuttal to “tough on crime” messaging: Don’t focus on punishment, but on reforms that improve public safety.

item.title: Avoid Costly Repairs: Don’t Ignore the Red Flags in a Property Inspection
item.description: Avoid costly surprises when buying property by addressing red flags in inspection reports.

item.title: India’s EtherealX puts $5M seed toward fully reusable launch vehicles
item.description: Indian space-tech startup EtherealX aims to test its fully reusable medium-lift vehicle in 20. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Drawing Attention
item.description: News Inside Issue 17 features the opinions of justice-affected people on Trump’s felonies, and a nonfiction comic about death penalty mitigation.

item.title: 5 Key Steps For Running a Successful Rental Business
item.description: If you're not following these five key steps, you're managing your rental business all wrong.

item.title: OpenAI co-founder Schulman leaves for Anthropic, Brockman takes extended leave
item.description: John Schulman, one of the co-founders of OpenAI, has left the company for rival AI startup Anthropic. In addition, OpenAI president and co-founder Greg Brockman is taking an extended leave — through the end of the year — after nine years at the company to “relax and recharge,” the company confirmed. Peter Deng, a product […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: These Private Centers Lack Oversight. Cuyahoga County Judges Send Kids Anyway.
item.description: Courts are increasingly sending children to private youth care centers, spending millions while detention center overcrowding persists.

item.title: Transforming Setbacks Into Success: 3 Personal Growth Lessons from My Real Estate Journey
item.description: Discover how setbacks in real estate can lead to success.

item.title: Secretaries of state urge X to stop its Grok chatbot from spreading election misinformation
item.description: Grok — not to be confused with the homophonic AI startup Groq that this morning raised over $600 million — has been spreading false information about Vice President Kamala Harris on X, the social network formerly known as Twitter. That’s according to an open letter penned by five secretaries of state and addressed to Tesla, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What It Means to ‘Willie Horton’ a Political Candidate
item.description: Donald Trump supporters run their version of the original dog-whistle attack ad against Kamala Harris. Here’s the history.
